results.title: Gas from Gippsland
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Describes the construction of the Brown Coal Gasification Plant at Morwell in Victoria’s Latrobe Valley. The Plant is designed to use the Lurgi High Pressure Gasification process and will be immediately capable of delivering 15 million cubic feet daily. Shows the laying of the 103 mile gas pipe-line to Melbourne and the official opening of the Plant by HRH the Duke of Edinburgh in December 1956.

results.brief_description: This film illustrates the expressions practised in actual use at a railway station in France, together with words and phrases commonly used by travellers.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.creator_credit: Seiji Koga, Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Koga Productions
results.brief_description: Generations of culture in Japan are shown in gardens existing for hundreds of years; varying in form and expression reflecting the influence of the period in which each was built. A temple garden with thick moss and symbolic arrangement of stones; dry landscaping; extravagant and imposing gardens with beautiful lakes reflecting the mountains beyond; peaceful and harmonious settings for the buildings which were set in them.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan Educational Film and Nihon Eiga Shin-sha
results.brief_description:
Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural
landscapes and which have symbolic significance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony.

results.title: Garden plants and how they grow
results.brief_description: Illustrates general principles of plant growth. Examines the interior of a seed; distinguishes plants which store food in their stems, leaves, roots and seed pods; compares plants grown in good and poor soil and in sunlight and shade; shows destructive animals and insects and those which are helpful to plants. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of bean seeds.

results.title: The Garden of Gujurat
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and UNICEF
results.brief_description: More than 20,000 farmers and their families were eking a bare existence in the Kaira District of India. Through a modern milk plant, contstructed with the co-operation of UNICEF, the Food and Agriculture Organisation, the Government of India, New Zealand (under the Colombo Plan) and their own co-operative, scores of communities are benefiting, as well as the thousands of school children who are receiving daily rations of safe milk.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and UNICEF

results.title: Gandhi's India
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes the life of Mahatma Gandhi, his policies and ideals and his influence on India’s progress towards independence. The film also considers how his views are related to Indian life in the 1960’s. Narrated by Alec Guinness.
